file_content.text: Yeah, yeah...
Take one last look around, suck on some of that Hutta air. Place'll stick with you when you're gone, agent.
If you've got business to wrap up, now's the time.
Need anything before we leave?
Nothing left for me. But we catch a flight offworld, then it gets interesting.
Don't tell me you really want to leave. You had a cushy job, got to keep Nem'ro company....
You know you'll miss it.
It's disgusting here.
Think the Hutta smell is off my boots. Should've kicked in more faces while it lasted.
You talk about violence very casually.
You enjoy fighting, don't you?
I'm a casual girl.
All that time in the swamp... tell me you don't want to go home, keep Nem'ro company....
I bet you miss Hutta.
If I get the urge to see the Hutt, he'll take me back. In the meantime, though....
That planet was disgusting.
I won't remember Jiguuna fondly.
Nah. But we catch a flight offworld, then it gets interesting.
Yeah, but just think about the future.
You and me against the galaxy--it's gonna be fun, all blasters and girl talk.
Something you want to gossip about?
Girl talk?
Nah. You take the smart boys, I take the rich ones, we're all good. Let's go.
You and me against the galaxy--just sweat, blasters and good times.
You shoot high, I'll shoot low.
We'll make a fine team.
That's the spirit. Let's get moving.
We really need to get some privacy soon.
[Flirt] Good times, indeed.
You just let me know, agent. Me, I got no shame.
Follow my lead--and don't get comfortable. You're not exactly Intelligence material.
Just learn to follow orders.
You want to tell me why not?
You're unsubtle and undisciplined. You'll get yourself killed if Keeper doesn't scrap you first.
Here's my appraisal.
Twenty credits says you're wrong. Let's go.
For starters, real operatives don't enjoy their work so much.
You're way too much fun.
You could be right. Let's go.
I'm not here to mentor you. Let's get going.
Not particularly.
Bad start, agent....
Blast it. You know what today is?
Today's the day I've worked with you longer than any of my exes.
Don't tell me you missed your chance to escape?
Guess you're stuck with me.
You make it sound like a prison sentence.
Is it such a bad thing?
Aside from no stun-cuffs, yeah, pretty much.
What about the Wheezer? Or Anspi'shel? There must be someone else.
That can't be true.
I don't know who you're talking about. As I was saying, I've been with you way too long.
Normally at this point, I'd skip out and go con someone new. But you've got me so freaking out of practice it's not worth the bother.
So I'll make you a deal. I stick with you, you keep me comfortable... I can live with this setup.
I can agree to that, Kaliyo.
It's a deal.
I think you showed your hand when you agreed to get married.
As if you'd really leave me...
You're way overconfident about what marriage means to me, agent.
You're far too pleased with yourself to go anywhere.
As if you'd really leave me...
Don't test me on that.
So I'm stuck dealing with you and your attitude?
Can't I ever get rid of you?
Pretty much. Feel lucky?
Tell you what... I'll make it easier to live with. I've given up teaching you anything, but we ever get someone new?
I'll show them the ancient blood traditions of Rattatak. And maybe how to down a Rodian ale without puking....
So look, agent--I'm at the cantina last night, and this Devaronian guy buys me a drink, wants to dance... I start thinking.
You and me've been pretty good together, right? So that means I'm supposed to be all loyal to you.
That is usually how it goes, in this sort of relationship.
A bit of loyalty is nice, yes.
I'm sorry--what were you doing there alone in the first place?
Why were you at a cantina?
I need to breathe filth, sometimes. Will you just listen?
By all means--if a strange man offers you a drink, take it.
Don't let me stand in the way.
You say that now, but then the blasters come out.
I figure, I don't need the temptation, but men aren't gonna stop flocking to me. So something's got to change.
First option is I dump you, I see all the men I want. Easy.
What's the second option?
Please, continue.
I can be very hard to get rid of.
Not so easy, actually.
Whatever.
I don't know where you think this is going, but I'm not enjoying it.
This isn't funny.
Yeah, but I am.
Second option is I find some better excuse to get rid of these losers. Something to wave in their face.
So--you gonna get me a wedding ring, or what?
Kaliyo... you really want to marry me?
Are you serious?
I'm sticking around anyway, and like I said--seemed to make sense. So what do you say?
Of course I'll marry you.
I want to hear three words you've never actually used.
Say "I love you" and I'm in.
You serious? You're not serious. We can call this off....
Yeah, I love you. Tell anyone and I bite your tongue off.
I love you too, Kaliyo.
I don't want to hurt you, but... that's not where I see this going.
I'm sorry, but no.
There's no one in the world I'd rather spend my life with.
I'd love to, Kaliyo.
Don't be a girl just because I'm sticking around. Start with the ring, and make it a good one.
It's gonna be good, agent. You and me....
Justify it how you like--a marriage is not in our future.
No way that's happening.
Well, can't blame me for trying. Would've sold the ring off in a week, anyway.
See you around, agent.
Look, I'm sorry to dump this on you, but you're gonna need to live without me for a little while.
It'll be quick, but I need time off to wrap up some personal things.
If you need to go, I won't keep you. Is there anything I can do?
Of course; I understand.
Sweet of you to ask, but no.
It's a little sudden, isn't it? What's going on?
"Personal things"?
Nothing big. Just some private stuff.
You can't just run off whenever something comes up.
Leaving isn't that simple.
Not like you've never had a distraction. Don't worry, I'll be a week, tops.
And I was worried I'd miss your departure. Kaliyo, we've had our differences, but I wanted to wish you the best of luck.
I'm sure the Wheezer and his Revolutionary Edge Brigade will be delighted to have you back.
I don't know what you're talking about.
I am surprised that you would permit this, though--letting Kaliyo see her old anarchist friends must violate any number of Imperial regulations.
Clearly, I haven't been filled in.
You two care to explain?
Enough. You do not casually accuse teammates of treason.
Doctor, you're out of line!
Of course. There's nothing casual about this.
I've traced encoded messages sent from this ship to the leader of the Brentaal anarchists.
If you're planning a betrayal, I swear to you....
You're in big trouble, Kaliyo.
That's not it. I was not going to betray you.
Then why the encoded messages, sent from this ship, between you and the leader of the Brentaal anarchists?
That's--look, it's not what you think.
The Wheezer got in touch, said he needed help. Didn't say why, but I figure security's cracking down on the cell again.
Why didn't you say anything?
You should've told me.
This man leads your old anarchist group?
Who's "the Wheezer"?
He's one of the guys who started it. He taught me everything.
He's hit mostly corporate targets, but Imperial assets seem fair game for the REB as well--just less convenient.
You were turning against us.
Then you admit it!
No, I wasn't!
The Wheezer was good to me, so I thought I'd lend a hand. I didn't want to get anyone killed; I wanted to protect you.
The Wheezer was good to me, so I thought I'd lend a hand. Figured telling you would make trouble, get someone killed.
If you don't trust me, come back with me and watch my back. We'll buy him off somehow. Might actually survive that way.
All you had to do was ask.
If I can help, I will.
Thank you.
I can make contact myself, or go through the Citadel....
Isn't there a better option?
He doesn't want your help, and he doesn't trust you. It has to be me.
She may have a point. And if the Wheezer is expecting her, he's a problem that must be addressed.
There's no way I'm letting you off this ship.
Not a chance.
You're making a mistake.
In fact, I tend to agree. If the Wheezer is expecting her, we should deal with him.
We'll do this, but we do it my way. You step out of line....
You're on thin ice, Kaliyo.
Yeah, I got it.
I suppose I've met everyone else you worked with. What's one more?
One more ex-partner to meet...
I'll get in touch with him. One call, to set up the meeting.
I'll leave you to your work.
We're all set. The Wheezer will meet us at the Hutta spaceport.
Just... try to make this go without a fight. I don't need to lose either of you.
Maybe I wasn't clear. We are not paying a visit to an anarchist cell.
Absolutely not. [Refuse quest]
Fine. Discussion over.
I'm sorry, I'm not authorized to discuss that.
Come on, I've been here longer than you.... Hey, agent.
You and the ensign--she doing much for you, these days?
Care to explain all this?
What's going on here?
Say the word, and I'll have a talk with her.
Temple, is she bothering you?
I can handle a crew dispute, sir. It's actually--it's your relationship. I hadn't fully realized.
Ensign Temple has her charms, but they're a bit old-fashioned.
Not much, no.
Sir.
Guess some guys like that kind of thing.
Sir, I wanted to talk to you about Operative Djannis--I hadn't fully realized what your relationship was....
She knew, didn't have the guts to say something.
Go on. Tell her you're ready for someone fresh.
You're a good person and a fine officer. And I wish it weren't happening this way, but... Kaliyo's right.
I'm sorry, Temple.
I'm sorry if you misunderstood. It's been good between us, but it's not real.
Kaliyo... Temple comes first.
Funny. Felt and sounded real. But it's okay--I got what I wanted.
Thank you, sir. But I think I need a bit of time myself.
You were fun while things lasted.
Is this clear? [Kiss Kaliyo]
That's all I needed to know. Excuse me.
Okay, I could've been nicer to her, but it's so hard.
I'm used to setups where you just squeeze guys or girls for whatever they're worth, then toss 'em.
Let me ask you something, agent.
You get around, you end up with lots of girls. I know it's the job, but... that ever mean much to you?
Not that I'm avoiding the question, but would you care to explain?
Why do you ask?
There have been times when it was a comfort. There've been people I cared about.
Keeper meant something.
Yeah... I've been there too, but it doesn't happen often. Mostly just squeeze 'em for what they're worth, then toss 'em.
It's the job, as you said. I use whatever tools I have to solve our problems.
It's all for the mission.
Right, exactly.
Unless there's a tryst I'm forgetting, I'm not sure I can answer the question.
I don't know who you mean.
I'm not trying to get you in trouble. I don't care about who you're with, I just....
I'm like you, you know? You squeeze guys or girls for whatever they're worth, then toss 'em.
Creeps me out a little to do things different.
Our relationship creeps you out?
"Different" like us?
A little, yeah.
I'm not used to a relationship like this either, Kaliyo.
It's hard for me, too.
I didn't say I wanted sympathy.
Look, I like you--but I don't know what I'm doing, and I don't know why you stick around.
I don't want you to be surprised if I shoot this thing in the head.
For what it's worth... I like you a great deal, as well. That's why I stick around.
You mean a lot to me.
Okay, that's enough of that.
You're talking about that man you brought aboard the ship.
Like when you cheated on me?
I don't know. Maybe, I'm not thinking about it anymore.
I'm gonna go check the cargo space. You want to come with me, great--but we don't talk. Got it?
You don't discuss your feelings very well, do you?
You're really awful at this.
Shut up, agent. Go away.
Is that where this is going? We talk about our feelings together?
Ugh. You're getting sappy.
Hey, you want to keep it physical, great. I'm not the one who started clinging around.
Grab me when there's something to fight--I'm in the mood.
Hello, Kaliyo. What's going on?
Hey. So, I've been thinking:
With all the stuff I've told you about my past... we ever talk about the Brentaal anarchists?
You've mentioned their existence, and that you worked with them. No details.
Just bits and pieces.
Then here's a morsel for you:
We haven't talked about them. But that's your prerogative.
You don't have to share.
And now I feel like reminiscing.
We were the Revolutionary Edge Brigade. Cell was probably me and a dozen other guys.
The "stuff you've told me" is mostly lies. But no, we haven't.
I don't know your past at all.
Come on, you met my exes. I told you half-lies, but they were for real.
Anyway, been thinking about the Revolutionary Edge Brigade. Cell was me and probably a dozen other guys.
We blew up holorelays, robbed banks, kidnapped politicos and corporate honchos... did a lot of damage.
You never struck me as especially political. Why'd you join the anarchists?
How'd you end up there?
Kind of an accident--I started with the local gangs, someone saw my potential.
I suppose you were vicious in your youth.
You must've been dangerous.
I've mellowed. REB let me blow stuff up and call it progress.
Not so different from the Eagle and his men.
Sounds like terrorism.
Yeah, but REB focused more on big business than the Empire.
I wasn't really in it for the philosophy. Even so, there's times I look at who we work for now, and....
...well, I never thought I'd end up helping a bunch of dictators. You know?
Sounds like you believe in what you did after all.
Is that idealism I hear?
Maybe, maybe not.
Dreams can be very different from reality.
I know how you feel.
Hey, you've probably got it worse than me.
We don't take orders from anyone. We help the people we decide deserve it.
We're free of the Empire, now.
Most of the time, anyway.
You serve the Empire now. There's no turning back.
No time for second thoughts.
People keep saying that.
Thing is, I'm actually pretty content. I've got money, company's decent--even your squad's growing on me.
Hypocrisy's a funny thing. See you around, agent.
I hope I'm not prying--I overheard a bit of your conversation and couldn't help but wonder:
Have you noticed anything unusual about Kaliyo's behavior lately?
I'm not sure why you're asking.
Not really. Why?
Less griping, more cheer. Other than that, no.
She's more upbeat than normal.
Interesting. I hadn't spotted that.
Spit it out, doctor.
Make no mistake--she seems perfectly ordinary to me.
However, I've noticed some encoded messages broadcast to and from the ship. Kaliyo has access to the relay, and I'm trying to assess all possibilities.
If you think she's up to something, talk to her, not me.
Kaliyo hasn't done anything.
Why, I'm not accusing her of anything. Merely gathering pieces of the puzzle.
And should the whole picture become apparent to me, I assure you, I'll share it.
Why are you monitoring our communications traffic?
You're spying on the crew?
I find intellectual stimulation where I can--certainly, I'll make an effort to show greater respect for privacy.
In the meantime... you can be sure I'll alert you if anything else crosses my eye.
Let me know if anything happens, or if you find out more about those transmissions.
Keep an eye on this.
Of course. I always enjoy a puzzle.
So, here's what I figure. Every morning, you get up, you exercise, you check your gear... you do your thing to prep.
You've got flowcharts tattooed on your eyelids. Me, I'm lucky when I don't crawl out of bed drooling on the floor.
How is it I keep up with you? Am I just that good, or does dirty fighting beat training after all?
I'd never argue your skills aren't impressive.
It's true, you are very good.
Trust me--it's not training and discipline that gets me by.
That's not exactly how I work.
Maybe. I'm still not convinced.
You're forgetting something. I save your life every fight we're in.
You can't keep up with me.
Maybe. But you'd be dead without me, too.
Admit it--we're a good team, you with the gimmicks and me with the rough stuff. We're not tripping over each other anymore.
Took a while, but you and me, we're a synced-up death machine!
Teamwork goes a long way. Imagine if we actually practiced together.
We've learned to coordinate.
I don't need to get that good. You want to go arms shopping together, though... let me know.
Give us a few more years, we'll be taking out star cruisers.
All right, we are great.
You set up the shot, I'll take it, agent.
You're the same as always--I just know how to adjust to your mistakes.
Only because I'm used to you.
We'll see about that, next time I'm aiming near your head.
Hey. I'm worried your shooting's a little off--all that tech stuff weighing you down.
But I'll make you a deal. You and me find a spot to practice, I'll help you out of your rut. No charge.
Are you feeling guilty about what happened?
Is this you apologizing?
I don't know what you're talking about. Just in a good mood.
I can spare some time. Let's see what you can teach me.
It's a deal.
Lot more than you'll bother learning....
Okay, good as you are, some day someone's gonna smack you from behind while you're lining up a shot.
Might even be me. Last time I felt like this was playing anarchist on Brentaal--my exes are gone, and I'm a free woman.
We ever go blasters-only, your kill count won't look good next to mine.
I'm going to assume that's your natural good cheer.
You're in a good mood today.
You assume right.
I knew you were competitive, but I didn't know you were so morbid.
You keep a kill count?
I appreciate the advice, but there's nothing wrong with my marksmanship.
My shooting is just fine.
Aw, don't be like that. You'll spoil my mood.
No one hunting me down, no exes mooning over me... last time I cleaned house, I was playing anarchist on Brentaal. Feels good to be free again.
What does a free woman do with herself?
So what's next for you?
I've got a lot of options. Might be time to move on.
That's not the first time you've talked about Brentaal. What did you do there?
You've mentioned anarchy...
The whole anarchy-freedom-destruction thing. Politics and bombs--the naivete of youth.
Course, now I'm matured, I need to figure a plan.
I think you're avoiding the subject.
Admit it--you do feel guilty.
Think whatever you want. Me, I'm pondering my future.
After all we did, I'd think some of it would trouble you.
So, no guilt about your exes?
You don't understand me, do you? It's okay, you amuse me anyway.
I've been thinking, though--now that I'm not looking over my shoulder, might be time to move on.
I could go after a big score, try something other than spy games... you could come with me.
You want to leave this life and seek fame and fortune together?
You're serious?
Why not? You can't do this forever, and you and me can see the stars... doing something.
You're not bad company, and I could use a change of pace.
It might be fun.
Yeah? You and me, traveling the galaxy... doing something.
Getting into trouble. Haven't worked it out past that, but I'll let you know.
I'm not going anywhere. I have a job to do.
My loyalty is to the Empire.
Why do I even bother? Forget I said anything.
You wanted to talk?
Hey... you're looking nice.
Can we do this a little later? I've got something going on...
Let me know when you're free.
Of course.
Anything I should know about?
"Something going on"?
Nope. Everything's good.
Much as I enjoy your games, I'd rather not play them while on a schedule. I'll see you later.
Don't waste my time.
Look, it's not like that.
Kaliyo? Why don't we go back to my place? It's a lot warmer than--oh.
Get out of here, Devon.
It's "Dibbon"....
Out!
Who is this man and why is he on my ship?
You want to explain, Kaliyo?
And take your shirt with you!
No need to hurry out. It's good to meet you, Dibbon.
Please, Dibbon, stay...
You, too. Look, she said it was her ship. I don't want to cause problems, so I'll just go....
Congratulations. You went home with the wrong girl, and now you're in a bad place.
You've made a mistake, Dibbon.
I swear, I don't want trouble. I'm going to go--you can keep my clothes....
Sorry. He's just a guy--I think he's a dock worker or something.
I found him the other night, we had a few drinks and I brought him here. Not a big deal, okay?
You're seeing other men behind my back!
You're cheating on me!
More than one. Because if I did it in front of you, I knew you'd get like this!
If it's not a big deal, you could've been up-front.
Then why'd you try to hide it?
So I didn't want you to know--figured you'd get all possessive, like we've bonded for life.
If you've got a problem, deal with it. I don't owe you anything.
You can do what you want to do, Kaliyo.
If you say so, fine.
I will! I like running with you, but I don't owe you anything.
I never said you owed me. I don't think I suggested it.
I'm not arguing with that.
So what, then? You just gonna stand there?
This is stupid, agent. I'm gonna have a shower.
I don't want to lose you, but I can't do this alone.
Help us make this work.
Just... let it go for now.
You may not owe me, but I thought there was something between us. You seem to be saying there's not.
Our relationship is important!
That's not what I said. And don't get all mopey.
Look, I've got a headache and I need a shower. We can... talk later, or something.
Without me, you'd still be serving Nem'ro on Hutta. Without me, your ex-partners would be fighting over your remains.
You owe me your life!
Yeah, I bet you think that. But you're boring me, agent; go cry on someone else.
[Let her go]
I didn't mean that--don't go.
Wait--I'm sorry.
Too late.
I've had enough. I can work with you, but I don't think I can live with this anymore.
It's over between us, Kaliyo.
Fine. Never figured you'd have the brass to want me.
Let's go down that list again. Rholl? Check. Yjal? Check. Ta Tigal? Check. The Menace? Check.
You and me, agent--we are freaking queens of the galaxy!
Four ex-partners, four planets, all dealt with. Maybe you're right.
We are pretty fantastic.
You and me, agent--we are freaking king and queen of the galaxy!
You have had some interesting relationships.
About all those people....
Kind of fun, seeing everyone again. Still can't believe Ona's working as a bounty hunter... she'll go far.
Kind of fun, seeing everyone again. Still can't believe you bought off the nasty little arms dealer.
Kind of fun, seeing everyone again. Still can't believe Ona tried to become a bounty hunter... she was such a mess.
And without Rholl, the Rimma's gonna be fair game for new pirates. Opportunity for everyone.
That's what happens when you run with the rich and deadly.
You end up with powerful folk.
Guess it is. Still doing it.
I notice you aren't mentioning Ta Tigal.
What about the card player?
What's to mention? He'll be fine; won't look for me again.
Anyone else from your past liable to turn up?
So that's it for your exes?
Well, you've met Nem'ro, and the rest are harmless.
Tell the truth: Do your ex-partners even begin to compare?
[Flirt] We are good together.
Not anymore, they don't. Clean slate!
I went along with your plan. That doesn't mean I'm happy about it.
Don't be proud of what we did.
What's your problem? We did great, no one else is trying to kill me--clean slate!
Forget those losers, forget the Empire if you want... you and me have got a future.
Forget those losers, forget Intelligence if you want... you and me have got a future.
Partners 'til the bitter end? Or is the day coming when I'm the one hunted down?
What kind of future, though?
If I knew, I'd tell you. That's part of the fun, though, right?
I liked my time with those guys, and I like my time here. Wouldn't have it any other way, so... thanks.
If we didn't, I'd be very disappointed.
Good thing, too. [Kiss her]
Mm. Come on--let's find somewhere nice and make a night of it. Spent enough time shooting today.
That's enough of that.
For the record, though--and I'm saying this once--I'm glad you were with me on this. Would've been... different without you.
You can share my future. Just make sure you can keep up.
I plan to enjoy it.
Oh, you want some competition? Make a list of your exes, see how fast I go through 'em.
Bet your past is even uglier than mine....
You've lied to, abandoned or tried to kill every person who ever cared for you. You manipulated me into erasing your past.
You betray everyone you meet!
You'll forgive me if I'm not in the mood.
What do you want me to say? Things'll be different? The point is, we're having fun now.
At least I was....
That's it for the list. Come on... let's go pat ourselves on the back.
That could've gone smoother, but no big deal. Just one left.
Two down. Halfway there, agent. Then we're home free.
That's one. We're off to a good start... just three more to go.
So here's the deal. I've been working through the list of guys and gals who might come after me--ex-partners, hookups, the usual.
I think I know everyone who's a problem. We hit them first, we clean house, I'm home free. Ready to go?
I assume you put together a strategy?
Do you have a plan?
Got to keep busy somehow while you're lining up sniper shots.
I'm not sure why you assume I want to help your vendetta.
I never said I'd help you.
I'm ready to hit them whenever you are. Last we talked, though, you were pussyfooting around.
I haven't committed because you haven't told me what you're doing.
I want to hear a plan, first.
Is it really necessary to go after these people?
You want to kill your exes?
If we don't, they'll come after me. They'll put attention on me, and your cover will be threatened.
First, they're after me. Second, they're drawing attention. Third, it's your job.
You must be imagining things.
I don't remember that.
I bet. Doesn't matter--you're gonna help me anyway.
I went over your head, talked to the Citadel boys about placing a few death marks. The Empire is now officially targeting my exes.
I went over your head, talked to the Watchers about placing a few death marks. Imperial Intelligence is now officially targeting my exes.
They let you assign death marks?
How'd you pull that off?
Been holding onto some favors awhile.
I have to admit, I'm impressed by your ingenuity.
Very clever.
There you go, talking dirty to me.
It is not your place to suggest mission objectives.
You're way out of line.
Then maybe I should just do this without you. I thought you'd want in.
There's four targets: Rholl, my pirate; Yjal, the arms dealer; Ta Tigal, the card shark; and that bounty hunter who's following along.
I've got locations, so all we need to do is show up and start shooting.
Don't you dare ignore me. I will not stand for insubordination--from anyone.
You're not listening to me.
Great. We'll just wait for my exes to come kill me.
You change your mind, you know where to find me. I love working together.
That'll work. Let's get started, shall we?
I'm in.
Flip a coin, see who we blast first.
I'm not killing anyone until we've exhausted all options.
Negotiate first, then shoot.
Fine, whatever gets you to go. You really aren't any fun.
This whole situation is a mess.
I don't like this.
Still got to clean it up somehow. Plenty of time to blame me afterward.
All right, we've got a problem. I told you about my ex-partners--how they decided to come after me?
Well that's fine. I can deal with that.
What's not fine is when random freaking bounty hunters come after me because they smell a trend!
Who's coming after you, Kaliyo?
Bounty hunters?
It'll be alright. Tell me what's going on.
Calm down and talk to me.
Don't give me that garbage.
You do know that most people don't have this problem?
I'm trying not to laugh.
Yeah. I know.
Guy's called "the Menace." Never worked with him, never dated him, never heard of him.
He's tracking me down, apparently got a rep as a duelist. Probably wants to auction me to anyone with a grudge.
This has gone far enough. We hunt him down and send a message.
Let's take him on.
I like it when you talk that way. I'll let you know when I have a plan.
Do we know his hunting style? Hangouts? Long-term clients?
Any other details?
No, no and no. Figure he can't be that good if I haven't heard about him, right?
You went after Anspi'shel to auction her off.
Like you did to your friend?
I nabbed her because it was personal. The money was just sense.
Look, we need to do something, get a little aggressive. You in?
What exactly are you planning?
Define "aggressive."
Don't know yet... still looking at my options.
Tell me what you need, and you've got it.
You know I will.
Not totally sure yet, but I'll let you know when I've got a plan.
You and me... we're gonna get these people.
Everything is secondary to the mission. You know that.
I can't promise anything.
Yeah, I know where your priorities are.
But we are gonna handle this. Just watch.
If you can guess who's been talking to Nem'ro the Hutt, you owe me a drink.
From your tone, I'd say I'm looking at her.
I'm guessing it's you.
Bingo. If you don't have a bottle on you, I'll take my prize in cash.
If I guess, I owe you a drink?
Wait--what?
It was worth a shot.
You think I enjoy guessing games? Talk.
Don't withhold information.
Fine, but next time I keep it to myself.
Me and the crime king were wrapping up some old business--long story, but he let slip something interesting.
Remember Yjal, my arms dealer-come-stalker? He's been touching base with a lot of guys I used to work with, Nem'ro included.
Why would he be talking to Nem'ro?
What does Yjal want?
Why were you talking to the Hutt, exactly?
Hold on. Go back to Nem'ro.
Don't get all possessive. Here's the point:
You knew Yjal would be a problem, and you let it go.
You should've foreseen this.
He just wants information. Here's the problem.
Now that Yjal's tipped his hand, some of my other ex-partners--the ones with grudges--they figure they need to hit me before Yjal does.
We're talking people who should've moved on years ago. Guess I left a mark.
You do have a way with people. What should we expect?
I can't say I'm surprised.
You have an awful lot of enemies. What exactly did you do?
How'd you annoy these people?
I want to know who these ex-partners are, and what we can expect.
We need a plan of action.
I'm not gonna make a list. But... first example who comes to mind? Card shark named Ta Tigal.
Not a lot of guts, but he was rich and cute... we lived the high life until I broke his heart. Bet he'll hire some sleazebag to find me.
If you hear anything about him--or Yjal, or anyone else--let me know.
Let's keep an eye out.
Yeah. Funny as it all is, I'm thinking we might need to do something about it.
Ta Tigal, card shark. Any other names?
Anyone else?
Told you about Yjal, Rholl... Nem'ro and I are good.
You and Ta Tigal. What was that like?
So you two were a couple.
Like I said, he was a card shark. Good with his hands....
Aw, don't be jealous. You're good, too.
I'll let you know if anything else turns up. We... might actually have to do something about this.
People don't chase after you for years just because you were a couple.
That can't be the whole story.
No, people don't chase after you for years. Me, I'm an addiction.
And I like getting you addicted to me.
Hey, agent. Take a look at this.
Where is she?
I don't know. How would I know?
Kaliyo Djannis and her Twi'lek associate were seen attacking Exchange resources on Nar Shaddaa.
Should I believe you wouldn't seek revenge? I want her last known location, and I want it now!
I love it. Listen to that little tremor in his voice--he's adorable!
Who was that, and why is he after you?
What is this?
He does say your name with fondness.
Looks like you've got a fan.
If someone's after you, it's a threat to operational security.
This is a serious problem.
Don't get your gun out yet.
Yjal and I go way back. Soon as I show my face, he starts torturing people to track me down.
He's been obsessed ever since we split up on Farstine. For an arms dealer, he's kind of sweet; makes me feel wanted.
Where did that holovid even come from?
How did you get the recording?
Hey, you've got plenty of sources--I've got a few, too, and one's close to Yjal.
And I thought you got plenty of that right here.
[Flirt] I'll show you wanted.
Mm. Sometimes a girl wants more.
If you've got such a bond, why not let him find you?
Maybe you should reconnect.
Like you've never had a guy come after you--it's all part of the game!
Not much of a game, then, is it?
You enjoy being stalked by an arms merchant?
You're a disturbed woman.
He could have anyone, but he wants me. I think it's nice.
Of course, if really he does find me... he might be dangerous. After all we've been through, can I trust you to help me?
If we can't rely on each other, who else is there?
Of course you can trust me.
Isn't that the truth?
Of course, if he finds me... he might be dangerous. I might need someone to protect me from the bad, nasty man.
What am I here for, if not to protect you?
[Flirt] It'd be my pleasure.
I can think of a few things.
Of course, if he ever found me, I'd have to choose. Do I go back with the bad, nasty man... or beat him down with someone new?
Against the two of us, I doubt he'll pose much threat.
We can take him.
Why go back peacefully when you can fight instead?
This is the fun part.
That's why I like you.
You're perfectly capable of protecting yourself.
You can't manipulate me.
No kidding.
Of course, if he ever found me, I'd have to choose. Do I go back with the bad, nasty man... or stick with the one I have?
I'm sure you'll know what to do.
You'll make the right choice.
Aren't you confident?
Stick with me, and you won't regret it.
[Flirt] You know the answer.
So many promises....
If you're trying to make me jealous, it won't work.
You can't manipulate me.
Then how do I know you even care?
I'll keep you in the loop--next recording gets out, we can watch it together.
Well, that didn't last--cash from Anspi'shel is gone. Cheapskate bounty hunter....
So, remember how I was gonna sell Anspi'shel to a bounty hunter, and you let her go?
I hope it was worth it; finally convinced the buyer we weren't trying to scam him.
You and Anspi talk much when you were together? Swap stories about the old days, gossip about me?
I told you: She said you lied.
You lied about your past.
She said you were a habitual liar, and that you'd only met in the past year.
You're still on about that? You're funny.
Yeah, figures she'd say something like that. She's kind of crazy.
She said one time, you tried to pull a scam on a Republic planning droid.
[Lie] Oh, she told stories.
Yeah, that turned out to be a mess.
You were there; we didn't have time to chat.
She didn't say anything.
Just figured I'd ask.
Whole thing got me thinking, though. I've had a lot of partners over the years--her, Nem'ro....
Guy named Rholl used to hijack Republic supply ships. He had money, he had brass--how you think you measure up?
Depends what your friend Rholl was really like.
I'd need to know more, first.
Bad temper, crafty, smelled but you got used to it. Best pirate on the Rimma, showed me a good time.
Whatever he showed you, I can show you one better.
I'll try not to disappoint.
You said you'd been partnered with Anspi'shel for years until you met Nem'ro. How does Rholl fit in?
Why'd you never mention him?
Eh, you know. I say a lot of things.
If I were to bet, I'd say Rholl wasn't as exciting as me. Otherwise, you'd still be with him.
[Flirt] I measure up well.
Hijacking Republic ships is only exciting the first time. I give you variety.
I bet I'm a lot more fun.
Ha! Okay, guess that explains one.
Still seems weird that with all the nasty, smart rich people I've been with, I ended up with you.
You're really comparing me to your former partners?
Are you seriously ranking me?
Don't be like that--just figuring why with all the nasty, smart rich people I've been with, I ended up with you.
We all need a break from the high life sometimes.
Guess you're just slumming it.
Fate's been kind to us. After all, our association has worked out well.
We're both lucky.
You're trying too hard, agent. Learn to take a joke.
We can talk when you're done sharpening your claws. I don't need the abuse.
I'm not dealing with this now.
I'm just joking, agent! Joking. Get used to it....
Agent. We need to talk.
I just heard from the Citadel. Your pals finally came through on a promise they made when I joined this outfit.
You have friends in the Citadel, now?
Who contacted you?
Some ex-Watcher sent the message. Not really the point.
I just heard from headquarters. Keeper finally came through on a promise she made when I joined up.
I just heard from headquarters. Keeper finally came through on a promise he made when I joined up.
I'm not sure why that's cause for complaint.
That sounds like good news.
Turns out they took a little long.
Keeper is contacting you instead of me now?
You heard from HQ directly?
Some Watcher sent the message. Not really the point.
I'm surprised you were promised anything, given the circumstances when you came aboard.
Be glad they bothered.
I'm an eloquent freaking negotiator.
I asked you guys to find Anspi'shel--old friend of mine, I told you about her. We hooked up after I left Rattatak.
Last time I saw her, she saved my life and got me to Hutta. I owe her big; now she's in trouble.
What sort of trouble?
Tell me the situation.
You said she saved your life?
What happened between you two?
On Ord Mantell. I messed up, and she covered my tracks.
You live a dangerous life, it catches up with you.
I can't say I'm shocked.
No kidding.
She crossed some Exchange buddies on Nar Shaddaa--report didn't give details, but I can guess how it went down.
I'm gonna head over, kill the Exchange and save the girl. You should come with.
I'm gonna head there, kill the Exchange and save the girl. You should come with.
You want my help, you've got it. Let's go.
I'm in.
Good choice. And so you know--we do this right, I've got a surprise planned for us.
Say I help you, help your friend... do we celebrate after?
[Flirt] What's in it for me?
Oh, yeah. I've even got a surprise planned for us. You're gonna like it.
Any particular reason you want me?
You're sure I should come?
You make good backup.
We have a mission, and it's not to help your friends.
This is a waste of time.
Part of my contract.
Besides--help me out, there's a surprise in it for you....
You smell like sweat and plasma burns. I like it.
How long've we got to ourselves? You know--before duty calls, the world goes to hell, all that.
There's no rush to get back to work--no more than usual, anyway.
We've got a little time.
Aw. A little rush could feel good.
I can arrange some time together, if you want.
[Flirt] Something in mind?
Yes, I want.
In this line of work, I wouldn't count on anything.
We're always on duty.
Too bad. You know what I was thinking?
You've been working hard, I've been working hard, we're both keyed up.
I was thinking we could slip off the ship, and celebrate your birthday.
I was thinking we could wander off somewhere and celebrate your birthday.
Last I checked, it's not my birthday.
My birthday?
It's not my birthday either; guess we'll have to slack off without an excuse.
Were you thinking dinner? Drinks? Maybe some dancing?
[Flirt] I like this....
Yeah, something like that.
This could be a very good night for you, agent.
Well... I'm sure we can find something worth celebrating.
Let's go, then.
Isn't this a bit sudden?
You want to do this here? Now?
You're here, I'm here, I'm in the right mood... give me one reason why not.
No reason. Just making sure.
I can't think of a thing.
Close your eyes and come with me.
Say it with me. I'm better than Temple in every possible way.
You're better than Temple... in every possible way.
I have to agree.
Say it with me. I'm the best thing that ever happened to you in this job.
You're the best thing that ever happened. And I'm not about to forget.
I have to agree.
Good boy.
If I brought you flowers, what would you do?
Not much for romance, are you?
Go look for a man?
But for now, I'm wiped. Let's find someone to shoot.
That discussion can wait. Now we have work to do.
We need to get moving.
Armed and ready, agent.
I won't say I'm not tempted, but we barely know one another.
I like you, but this is fast.
Somehow, I didn't think there was that much to know. Forget it, agent--just forget it.
You're crazy.
It's not my birthday, and I'm not interested.
I don't feel like celebrating.
We can trade innuendos later. I'm not in the mood.
Let's discuss this later.
Fine. Guess I'll find someone who is.
You smell burnt flesh, that's my fingers--gun overheated in the last fight.
So, all that one-shot kill stuff you do... where'd you learn it?
The Empire puts operatives through extensive weapons training.
Intelligence taught me.
I bet they do.
It was part of my training. I can show you exercises, if you like.
Interested in learning?
Yeah... I like getting off more than a round a minute.
It's called aiming. You let go of the trigger and look before you fire.
Don't even bother.
Doesn't have much style, does it?
I learned to shoot with a friend of mine... first year out of Rattatak, I was a mess.
Me and Anspi'shel hooked up on a tramp freighter. She was running, too; we stole a holdout blaster and shared it.
Were you in trouble?
Why did you need a blaster?
Not at first, but we got there.
You said her name was Anspi'shel?
Tell me about your friend.
Twi'lek name--think they say it easier.
You were young, innocent, just looking to protect yourself?
I can't quite picture that.
I was. She was something else.
She had gang connections, so one time we're raiding this ship's cargo bay, planning to sell whatever we get.
Turns out it was an Exchange ship, syndicate stuff. We've just pried open the storage crates when we figure it out. We're dead meat, right?
With one holdout blaster, the odds weren't in your favor.
Not a good situation, no.
They must have had quite a reputation.
The Exchange was that scary?
You cross the Exchange, they track you down and cut you up.
Best we can figure, I torch the place while Anspi grabs a dock worker. Then we sit and wait for the Exchange.
Enforcers finally show, we blame the dock worker and say we came to stop him--prove we're Exchange material. They bought it.
Risky, but I guess it paid off.
Not a bad con.
Best kind of risk. Anspi'shel ended up worse off later, but it was great for me.
What happened to the man you framed?
What about the dock worker?
Oh, Anspi shot him so he couldn't rat us out.
If you weren't invested in the job, you should've known when to cut your losses.
You just made things worse.
I had debts; Anspi'shel wasn't big on quitting.
She was fun. We ever run into her, we should get together--time of the century.
I'm sure it was wild and fascinating, but I can guess the ending: You survived.
I'm in no mood for anecdotes.
Pretty much. Lesson learned--the guns are fun, but I can kiss and break skulls just as good without.
You said you wanted to talk?
What? Yeah, sorry--no idea what I was gonna say.
Been distracted, thinking about home.
You never told me where you come from.
Where's "home"?
Red dirtball of a planet way out near the Unknown Regions.
I haven't seen Csilla--my people's homeworld--in ages.
I know the feeling.
So you know what it's like. Doesn't matter how things were, it still sticks in your head.
We don't spend a lot of time in comfortable surroundings.
This is lonely work.
You miss your family and a cozy bed?
Never thought I'd hear that.
Said I was thinking; didn't say I missed it.
Life was miserable on Rattatak. Backwards people living in caves, big on tribal blood feuds....
Almost got stoned to death when I was twelve. That's when I knew I had to get out.
You're going to have to explain that. When you say "stoned"....
You almost got stoned?
Rocks, fist-sized, thrown at me.
My dad was from a "cursed family," which is basically tribal propaganda for "we want your land."
Some great grandfather of mine was a warlord. Conquer a few tribes and you're "Cannibal-demon of the Summit."
Being a cannibal-demon's descendant couldn't be easy.
Tough reputation to live with.
Like I said, stonings. No way I was staying planetside.
How did your father and the others handle it?
What was your family like?
Kept their pride, hid the loot. Not that I got anything, or I might've stuck around.
This is why most species end up slaves to the Empire.
Superstitious primitives.
Most species don't have teeth. Like I said, though, I couldn't stay.
So how'd you get offworld?
Eventually, you escaped.
Are you expecting a hug?
Don't get all soft on me.
No, I just--I thought we could talk.
I hitched a ride on a spice trafficker's ship. Figured the big, civilized galaxy would have a place for me.
I thought I was gonna get accepted. I had to get tough.
This spice dealer--did he help you do that?
Where'd you end up next?
Not him. Other friends, mostly. I don't want to bore you.
You don't have to be tough. I'm here for you. Anything you need....
[Flirt] I'll protect you.
Can you--can you stop for one minute? I try to tell you something, and you're all over me.
Just forget I said anything.
The galaxy isn't a friendly place. The sooner you learn that, you sooner you adapt.
We all get tough sometime.
Can't argue there.
But it's nice talking like this. We should do it again.
I don't know what you're trying to pull, but I'm not impressed by the sob story.
You expect me to believe this?
Hey, fine--you don't want to hear it, I won't tell you anything.
That's why I don't talk about myself. You freaking people throw it in my face.
You're very good at this game, you know that?
I know you're not serious.
You're right--I was out of line, and I apologize.
Kaliyo, I'm sorry.
Too late for that, agent. Some other time.
I'm not listening to this anymore.
That's enough!
Yeah? Well, it's been real fun, agent.
Hey--so, I've got credits and a couple free hours. You want to find a cantina, have a few drinks, start a few fights?
Are you planning to cause trouble, or just expecting the worst?
What'd you have in mind?
Little of both. Figure we can get to know each other. Besides, I need a wingman.
I don't spend many of my off hours in cantinas.
Not my usual pastime...
So try something new. Not like you have something better to do.
I should warn you: They train us to tolerate a hard night out.
You're in for a surprise.
Yeah? Then come on--impress me.
If you don't have work to do onboard, you're not looking.
Your duties come first.
Come on--my guns are clean, what else is there? Have yourself a night off.
All right, Kaliyo. Lead the way.
Let's give it a shot.
You're more fun than you look, agent. But I'm still a better dancer.
Keep this up, maybe this'll work out after all.
Just get back to the ship before we leave--and don't draw attention to yourself.
You go. I'll pass.
You know how to spoil the fun. Maybe Bugboy will come along...
You know how to spoil the fun. I'll bring you home a souvenir.
I'm not going anywhere, and neither are you.
You're staying here.
Fine. Guess it's true what they say about Imperials.
Hey--I know I've been busy, but when are you gonna buy me that drink?
Something going on? Or are you just feeling friendly?
You're in a good mood.
Little bit of both.
Tell me what you like, and I'll fetch two.
Name it, and it's yours.
First things first.
I never promised to buy you a drink.
Excuse me?
Bet you want to.
I know how you treat girls on missions. You see someone you want, you go after her; make her want you, too.
It's a fun game for a while, but we both can play better. You agree?
I like a game that has challenge.
[Flirt] I agree completely.
I know how you treat girls on missions. Play the professional, get their interest, and then just walk away.
You can't walk away from me. How does that make you feel?
You're really not one for subtlety.
Coming on strong, aren't you?
What's the point? So... drink, or no drink?
I couldn't possibly refuse.
I'm in.
No drink, Kaliyo.
Not interested.
Fine! You're not the only one who'll buy 'em.
Why would we want to walk away, before we've even gotten close?
[Flirt] I think I like it.
My thoughts exactly.
So let's take a walk and find a cantina....
...you don't know how to dance and hold a gun. I can show you sometime.
Have to call it a night for now, though.
We'll have other chances. I like having you on board.
Another time, then.
Sure you do, agent. I'll see you around.
We don't have to. I'm sure the mission can wait.
Why stop here? [Kiss her]
Hey! It's been fun, but the mood's long gone. Get going before you bore me.
That's a little sudden, isn't it?
Something go wrong?
The mood's gone, agent. Get going before I get bored, and maybe we'll do this again.
I'm not going to dignify this.
Back off.
Yeah? Why not?
I like you, Kaliyo. I'm glad you're on my team. Can that be enough?
You're a friend, nothing else.
You're kidding.
Ha! Okay, agent. Next move is yours.
You're unstable, unreliable and frankly, I question your motives. Not much to build a relationship on.
Because you're messed up.
Yeah. That's what I wanted--a deep,long-lasting relationship. Get going.
Trust that I have reasons, and leave it at that.
I'm really not interested.
Fine--I'll "leave it at that." Loser.
Hey, agent--can I give you a tip?
Don't waste my time, okay? I'm not about to quit this job, but there's a lot more people I can spend my time with.
What's wrong? Talk to me.
You're upset.
Don't act like I'm three years old.
I don't deny you could find other people. I rather hope you won't.
I like spending time with you.
Sometimes you're a sap.
I don't see anyone else.
People like Vector and Doctor Lokin? Somehow, they don't seem like your type.
Maybe you haven't noticed, but your options are rather limited.
Not everyone I play with has to be on this ship.
Look, these things happen--I get it. All I'm saying is, if you wanna keep me around, you gotta try at least.
I will try. Just don't judge too hastily.
Give it all some time.
Not like I'm going anywhere anytime soon.
I can't work with you if you don't tell me what's wrong.
Tell me what you want.
What am I, your handler? Figure it out!
Has anyone told you how frustrating you are?
You're impossible.
Yeah, I've heard it before. Usually, there's a lot of begging afterward.
Yeah, I see you--I'm supposed to fawn all over you just because you're standing there?
I do have other uses for my time.
You were the one who approached me.
I thought you wanted to talk.
A while ago.
Tell you what--why don't we find somewhere private, and I'll see if I can cheer you?
[Flirt] Don't be mad....
Yeah, because I really want you right now.
You're off your game, agent. When we got together, I kind of expected more.
I'm not sure I'm following you.
Expected more... what?
You're boring me, and you're not putting on much of a show for anyone else. Deal with it.
I've made mistakes, but that doesn't mean this is over. I'll win you back.
I won't let you push me away.
Sure you will. Get out of here.
I'm the same man I've always been.
That's your problem, then.
Fair enough. Guess I messed up, then.
I don't need this, Kaliyo.
Fine--ignore me.
Neither do I, agent. I can get men crawling on their hands and knees in five minutes flat.
You just make we wonder why I'd bother.
Hi, agent. Let's keep this short and civil, okay?
You and me are through. I'll stay on your team, but... yeah. Personally, we're through.
Just like that? What went wrong?
We're breaking up?
I'm not going to rehash it. Go ask advice from Doctor Lokin or something.
I'm not going to rehash it. Go call up your friends in the Citadel or something.
I can't say I didn't see this coming. We tried.
I understand.
More than I can say for some guys. You remember Nohn Veyaiko, from Hutta...? Eh, that story can wait.
Look, don't get jealous, don't cut my pay, we'll be fine.
Back to how we started. Let's show the galaxy what we can do.
We're partners, then.
Fine by me. I could use a fight.
If things change again, what would you think of...?
Is there any chance...?
How can you joke? Doesn't this mean anything to you?
Show some emotion!
Please. Tell me you're kidding.
Well--I'm glad that's finally over.
It's about blasted time.
Kind of a disaster. Huh... maybe this won't be so awkward.
Just don't try to make out with me next time we're in a war zone. I won't take it friendly.
So we're clear? Imperial rations are nasty, and I lived on grubs and two-credit wine for a year.
They raise you on those things, no wonder you're a bunch of stiffs.
I'll request more variety in our supplies next time.
Let me see what I can do.
Not even a smile.
You make it sound like you don't like the Imperial lifestyle.
Not enjoying yourself?
Only time I kneel is to puke in the refresher.
Imperial rations are designed for human biology, not... you.
I blame your species' tastes.
Yeah, well--I'm not eating what you feed slaves.
I was raised in the Chiss Ascendancy. We don't do Imperial rations.
I wasn't raised Imperial.
Yeah, you're blue, but you still got the accent.
Here's what I don't get. You got a little brass, you got a little style... you're not totally one of them.
But you still stick around busting heads for the Empire when you could--whatever.
But you still play Keeper's pet, shoot all the right people when you could work for--whoever.
You've seen the people trying to destroy us. The Republic, terrorists, traitors... someone needs to stop them.
The Empire needs protection.
You're serious? That's sweet.
I could point out that goes for you, as well.
You work for them, too.
You mean you could avoid the question.
I get to lie, cheat and murder, legally and for profit.
I like the job, and it pays.
I'll give you that, but you could do better.
Me, I'm in long enough to lay low, pick up some cash... sort out some personal stuff you guys can help with. Then I'm gone.
What sort of personal stuff?
"Personal stuff"?
Made a deal with your bosses when I came on board. Nothing you need to worry about.
Now let's get back to it before the world misses us.
Who knows? I show you a good time, you might change your mind.
Maybe you'll want to stay.
You're fun, agent--but you're not that fun.
You know too much to simply walk away.
No one leaves us alive.
You don't walk out on Imperial Intelligence.
No one leaves us alive.
When the time comes, try and stop me.
Kaliyo? You wanted to speak?
Not really, but I figured I'd let you in on a little secret.
You're messing up big time. Even Nem'ro knew how to run his kingdom--you're giving away the keys to everyone except me.
I think you've gotten a lot out of this.
I've treated you just fine.
Cash doesn't mean much when I'm bored, agent. Anything else... well, it helps, okay?
But a kingdom without a king... it's a sorry place to live.
All right, then tell me: How do I set things right?
You're unhappy with things?
Take my advice and start showing some brass. It might even keep you alive.
Thank you for that advice. Now find something useful to do.
Don't bother me with whining.
You don't want to say that stuff to me, agent. Bad things happen....
Hey, agent. You ever keep a pet womp rat?
I've missed out on that experience.
I can't say I have.
Tell me why you ask, Kaliyo.
Is this a riddle?
Womp rats make fine targets. Not so good pets.
I prefer to shoot vermin.
You get to appreciate them, you live on enough tramp freighters.
Thing about a womp rat is, you got to keep their teeth sharp. Give them something to chew on--makes them comfortable.
You might think it's fine to let the teeth get dull--but then it really hurts when they try to chew your freaking face off.
What's the point of this story?
I'm not sure I understand.
If you have a problem, let's solve it. I want to keep you on this team.
We need to work this out.
Good. Start by making sure I get mine.
Then we'll see if it's worth my bother to stick around....
And are you planning to chew my face off?
I hope that's not a threat.
You never know.
I'm better than this, agent. I'm better than you.
And you should be grateful that I've stuck around as long as I have....
No time to chat, agent.
Let's talk, when you get the chance.
Let's talk sometime on the ship, okay?
Before I joined Intelligence, I was a professional killer.
I used to be an assassin.
That figures.
We'll manage. But you aren't taking our secrets with you.
I see. [Attack]
Stupid, stupid move!
You have no idea how much I'm looking forward to this. The things I've heard....
They're all lies. I'm going to surprise you, Vigo.
You're just in time to say goodbye; that's my ride out of here.
What do you mean, "goodbye"? Who was that?
You're leaving?
I know you've been unhappy, but there's a lot we can discuss.
Let's talk about this.
What's to discuss?
I wouldn't start packing yet. What's going on?
You're not going anywhere.
The nice man from Black Sun made an offer; wants to keep me on retainer.
It's nothing personal, agent, but the Empire will just have to soldier on without me.
You can't just walk out. Kaliyo, listen to me....
Any chance you'll reconsider?
The thing is... I can just walk out. I've wasted too much time here already.
If you have to go, go. I'm sorry it turned out this way.
Good luck, then.
Hey, you never know--we might meet again sometime.
I'll be watching.
Tell the rest of the team... ah, you'll come up with something.
Not really a surprise, I have to say.
I'll drop a tracker on her. If she causes trouble, we'll know.
Don't get all needy on me.
Don't look at me--I don't know what we're doing. I just shoot things.
Sure thing, agent.
Are we waiting for something?
What are you looking at me for? Aren't you in charge?
Yes, sir! Lock and load, sir!
I'm making you look good, agent. You should be grateful.
If you say so.
Of course, agent.
Don't push it.
We're going to make an excellent team.
Not that I'm complaining, but don't we have a job to do?
Shh. Don't spoil the moment.
Now's really not the time. Maybe later?
Watch yourself, all right?
Don't be stupid....
